text: This will do the job if you're stumbling in drunk from the bars and you're taste buds aren't at peak performance. I ordered delivery and the turkey sausage had the texture of rubber. Turkey burger was only saved by the Sriracha mayo I had at home.

Fast service, amazing food, large portions, reasonably priced. The tables turned over quickly, so although they were busy, we were sat quickly.  My wife had stuffed French toast with marmalade and I had the egg quesadilla with Pico de gallo and hash browns.  The has browns had the perfect amount of spice.
This is my favorite place to grab a cup of coffee, eat some breakfast, and read. I love the family atmosphere and they have a huuuge menu!

I've always walked by this diner, and made a million mental notes to come here for breakfast.  There are always lines out the door, and the restaurant is filled on a given weekend morning.  I finally made it after living in Lakeview for 6 years, and it was just ok.  I wasn't amazed or wowed.  It was just the typical diner food.   I had one of their skillets, the Mexican Jolt.  It sounded delicious with having ground beef, jalepeno, cheese on a bed of hash browns but it was just a normal skillet.  It was also a little dry for my preference.  The skillet itself felt like it was missing something. The diner is cute, and it has a nostalgic feel.  The staff is super nice although the one rule on the weekend was a little annoying.  The weekend rule: your entire party needs to be there to get seated and there's really no good waiting area.  I'll give this place another try, and get some of the other Yelpers favorites to see if it was just a off item on the menu.

When we walked in we were greeted right away by Gus, the owner. Once we sat down he told us the story of his diner, which was originally opened by this parents over 50 years ago.  I ordered the avocado and cheddar burger with fries, and a chocolate milkshake. Everything was good, I ordered my burger medium but it could have been more medium.  The one thing negative I would say is that around 9:30 they said they were closed and that if you hadn't gotten food yet you weren't going to get it. And at 9:45 they said it was time to pay because everyone wanted to go home. They technically close at 10pm and while I understand wanting to go home after a long week, it isn't hospitable to customers to kick them out. So I didn't love that interaction, but I will be back to try breakfast soon...and get another milkshake.

I am a native Chicagoan, returned after decades. This is what I remember corner restaurants run by Greeks should be like. The food is great. The prices fair. The menu is big and full of traditional American standards like meatloaf. I had the Mad Texan Egg Skillet. I wish that I could give you a taste. Their chili is a little sweet to me but I am extremely fussy on chili. The people are friendly and treat you like family. I always pay in $2 bills and some businesses frown on this but they just treated it like the currency it is. There is a problem with the location. Ladies, don't let your significant others eat here alone. I am 69 and not in the market but even I noticed. The street was full of attractive females. It looked like they set up for movie or TV scenes. I don't know but it was so. The area around was under road construction but I walk around anyway for exercise. It is full of neat restaurants like a Turkish, a Cuban and one called The Red Pig. There is even a used book store.Space cadets, I will be reporting from that area again. Stella' s draws me like iron filings to a magnet.
Love this place!  everything you could want in a diner.  the milkshakes are soo good.  I also love the chicken fingers and the egg hudson

A very quaint diner! Their menu offerings are excellent, with a large selection of all day breakfast items. Their monster mozzarella is my favorite- nothing beats a gooey chunk of cheese! I do wish they had better steak options to accompany their breakfast choices. Maybe it's just my opinion, but a diner should have a classic steak and eggs option. Food was excellent and the wait staff were all checking in on me throughout my experience. I will definitely be back!

This is a typical diner, nothing more and nothing less. Bright colors on the wall, glass dessert case up front, and plastic booths that make your legs stick in the hot summer months.  The food was decent. I split a BLT with a friend and enjoyed it despite two things: it took over 25 minutes to receive the single sandwich, and it was smothered in mayo despite ordering it without. The breakfast at other tables looked delicious, but it's hard to mess up some eggs and toast. Side note: There is a wall menu of lots of milkshake flavors that I'd like to come back and try.  The staff was friendly with the exception of the rude (owner?) woman in charge of the front desk where you pay on your way out. I definitely got the vibe that if you're a regular then you'll be treated like royalty while the rest of us are a mere annoyance.

Don't believe the hype. I've been here multiple times and the food is always subpar. The experience is nice, as it has a very retro/old school diner aesthetic, but the food is flavorless. I mean you have to drown this stuff in syrup, salt & pepper, and hot sauce to get any inkling of flavor out of these dishes! I wanted to like this place so badly as it's right by my apartment and the aesthetic ticks all the boxes for an american diner, but the food is just not worth the money. It's a little bit pricey too. Food: 2.5 - no flavor, poor value Service: 4 - usually pretty good but sometime its awful decor: 5 - lovely aesthetic Go to Nookie's instead. They do this magical thing where they add flavor to the food. Overall it's about a 3 star experience for me dawg.

I ate here about 6 years ago (when I lived nearby)... and have been meaning to come back since I loved the pesto pasta dish I had.  But for some reason I only ever passed by very late at night after they had closed.  Today, however, I was in the area to see a flick at Landmark Cinema and made a point to accomplish my goal before the 7-year itch set in. The handsome, lanky, long-haired waiter was delightful... as was the gorgeous gal who whipped-up my cherry malted (and cleared my used dishes).  I was craving a bacon cheeseburger (with a fried egg on it) and it certainly hit the spot. All-in-all, it was a nearly perfect visit and I do hope to return again someday.

We stopped in to split a strawberry milkshake and it was very tasty, the decor was nice, and our server was attentive and polite.  The shake was thick, creamy, and blended well and we were given two straws and two strawberries.  There were no actual strawberries in the shake, so we were a little disappointed in the strawberry flavoring, but overall we had a nice time.

Okay, I just want to BLAB Stella's Love everywhere but, that's not helpful, so: this place is my second home. Coming from a small town originally, I am someone that values a small business feel/approach which if the comfyness you get here.   And if you don't get the same servers/bus boys, they know the ones you know.  I love diner food in general but you may think me biased but, let me suggest (as I always appreciate in reviews) the pesto turkey sandwich, that's my go-to (they grilled the sliced turkey, on grill, YUM).  My previous go-to: the muenster broccoli omelette, get it, so much cheese... Also delish: greek salad, they don't describe it which is annoying, because ti's YUM, but they are all greek and 'how DARE you not know!?" ask, it's YUM. I also like the egg salad on croissant, also the reuben... Oh my, the CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP... I beg for friends to pick up when I'm under the weather...  oh oh, I'm not a sweet tooth! but they have MAD desserts and malts and ice cream, so come get those too.... Gus.  He'll harass you. Maria. She be lovely.  I love these people.  But I don't JUST love to eat here to see them.  But, please, GO TO STELLA'S. Meow  I'm a dog walker.  girlmeetsdog.com
The owner is probably the nicest person I have met in a long time. The food was amazing. This place is probably our new go to restaurant whenever we are in the city. Highly recommended.
Good quality diner food. Hefty portions. They're not going to blow you away with flavors, but they're going to deliver on what they promise in the menu.

First time here yesterday! The food and staff were f*cking awesome. It's a pretty chill spot for a diner and BYOB, too. The owner is a cool, easy going dude and his daughter, one of the waitresses, was fast, hilarious and made really good suggestions from the menu. They make their own ranch and it makes Hidden Valley ranch look like a total jackass. They also make this garlic sauce which is the owner's recipe - it's godly. When you're there, you almost forget that you're in the yuppy, hyped Lakeview neighborhood and more so like you're in your hometown Greek diner. Grab some beer, drag your friends from Netflixing on their mom's couch, and head here for a night of living in the moment.
French toast so good the scamper eggs perfect and my eggs Benedict with the hash bowls very good. I like my hash brown crunchy so it's was very yummy
Ordered carry-out online. Order was ready when promised and food was hot. Generous portions and everything tasted great! Will definitely be back!
Great local diner.  Breakfast has a nice "home cooked" feel to it.  Shakes are da bomb.

This is definitely my new favorite breakfast spot near work. I got my food to go and only waited about 10 minutes. I ordered the special with eggs, bacon and pancakes and everything was so good! The pancakes were large and very fluffy and the eggs were perfect! Coffee was excellent too! Can't wait to eat here again!
Yum! Well priced, great service, and delicious! We are from Texas and they had an awesome Texas dish and made an egg white omelette without complaint. Yum yum yum.

Pretty darn sad we wasted our money here. For 2 people, it was $40, not including tip. Really pricey for diner food if you ask me. The best thing here was the milkshake I'll say. For just $5, it was reasonably price and decent.  We ordered -Country fried steak ($13) -Meatloaf ($14) -Butterfinger milkshake ($5) -Mac & Cheese Munchie ($5) The food was mediocre. My boyfriend who was super excited for the mac and cheese was disappointed. I took a bite and it tasted like mush. They definitely overcooked the elbow macaroni so it just kinda all tasted like cheesy mush. Super disappointing. Service was good but that's not why I come to restaurants.

Standard, nothing special diner breakfast fare with a side of rudeness. My friends and I had just finished up our meals and were asked to leave to make room for other patrons (the line was "out the door", the waitress said). There were many other tables available, not that long of a line, and we had only been seated about an hour. Unacceptable and terribly rude. I won't be back.

Stella's Dinner, is good to eat at, but the cashier is a no good jerk. The cashier has lots of tattoos on his arm. He said do you need change, I said no I'm waiting to pay my bill. There was a lady in front of me and I said she  was here first. He said I would rather look at her for 30 seconds, than look at you. However the waitress was kind and professional no problems with her at all.

The service is very friendly and helpful and the place has a real family owned feel about it.  Lots of great breakfast options but the house pancakes are a must. You should also check out the Country Eggs Benedict which is delicious and hearty. A great spot in the Lakeview area. Affordable too.

THIS IS THE BEST DINER IN CHICAGO! I'm from a town that has diners everywhere so I was surprised to see that there aren't many diner style restaurants in Chicago. I came across this one and it was pretty life changing. The Vegetarian Egg skillet is so good .

We love Stella's diner. It's amazing for breakfast, if you ask for crispy hash Browns they will make them well. Everything is good, it is a clean and friendly place. The owner is usually there and the waiters are great. Entrees are abundant and the price -quality relationship is good too, specially for the location. We go there really often and so far not once we have been disappointed. It's for sure a safe bet!

I've past Stella's for the past 2 years but finally stopped in today with friends and I'm so happy we did! It was one of the best meals I've had in a while with a great waitress and atmosphere. We all got a variety of food from pancakes and waffles to a grilled chicken sandwich on a croissant (it was AMAZING) and were all pleased! We even went back an hour later to get milkshakes (which were also AMAZING). Can't wait to go back!

Solid diner food. I got the eggs Benedict but swapped in sausage instead of ham. It was absolutely delicious! Everyone else enjoyed their various meals. Lots of specials of the Mexican variety. Waitress was knowledgeable, nice and fast. Side of bacon could be crispier and parking around here is a real challenge.

This place is bomb! Went here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon with two friends. We were quickly seated by really friendly staff. Place is nice and clean. There are two gender neutral and clean bathrooms, and the place is actually pretty big.  The waitress gave us enough time to look over the large menu before coming back for orders. I got the hot roast turkey sandwich, which was so good. The mashed potatoes tasted like real potatoes and not powder. A friend got the spicy steak sandwich, medium rare, which he said was super tender and juicy. My other friend got a skillet which was hearty, filling, and delicious. The shakes here are also huge, and to die for. Definitely don't come here looking for a bunch of diet meals. The mac and cheese was a little soft for my taste, but still tasted good.  All in all, great experience and we will be back! They really make you feel like family.

Very mediocre. Long wait. Didn't even finish more than half my meal because it was so bland and blah!! However the milkshake was very good. Bad service as well, checkout girl had a nasty attitude for no reason and the seating system is a fiasco. You couldn't pay me to go back.
Great food & fast service! If you're trying to go on the weekend, expect a wait... This place is super popular amongst the hangover crowd.

I've been meaning to come to Stella's for ages since I'm basically Ron Swanson when it comes to breakfast food. Service was prompt and friendly and we only waited five minutes for a table. Food came quickly and portions were huge. The food itself tastes fine, pretty standard diner fare for a good price (I'm throwing shade at you, Yolk). Since there are just so many other breakfast spots, this probably won't make my regular brunch rotation, but is perfectly adequate for fast diner breakfast.

Stella's is home.  You can always count on a delicious meal that feels like it's been home cooked by family.  My husband and I are here most weekends for breakfast, it is always lively, clean, and the staff is friendly and familial.  Our food always comes quickly and we are never wanting for refills on water or coffee.  Almost anything that can be made in house, is made in house and you can taste the difference.  Stella's is everything you want from an old school diner and more. Today I was feeling under the weather and went in looking for some soup.  Gus told me what he had on the menu, and when I politely declined due to food allergies he asked me what I could eat, told me to sit down, walked back into the kitchen and came back with a little cup of chicken and rice soup he just made that second.  Just for me.  He told me they keep their broth separate from the noodles for Chicken Noodle Soup and he had a few things he thought would be good with it and just threw something together for me.  If I didn't like it, no big deal - but if I did (and I SURE DID) he was happy to help.  I was already a Stella's die hard , but that just sealed the deal for me.  He went above and beyond without me even asking, treated me like family and made a life long loyalist out of me.
I love a place where everyone knows your name. And Stella's has become that place for me. I come in daily and they know my order by he

I'm in love with Stella's. I've gone there a few times now and it's a place I constantly want to go to. The food is really good and the prices are reasonable. The service is lovely, and I enjoy the decor. It tends to get a little crowded during the weekends, but I've never waited long to get a table.

* tried Stella's Diner today 2/5/17 * we had no wait which was surprising on a Sunday morning.  * almost as soon as we were seated , the bus staff brought water and asked for our drink order * soon after our server arrived and we placed our order for : The West Coaster, the Firehouse Breakfast Special and The Breakfast Special. My husband asked for them to substitute corned beef hash for the hash potatoes but they wouldn't even for an up charge. The food arrived in a timely manner, was hot and plentiful.  * we would frequent this diner if we lived in the area
Great food. Family like friendly servers and owner. Best brunch place for me. I aint go anywhere else if I would want brunch.

I came to this place literally, every day for 1 week when I was taking my finals in grad school.  The portions are hearty and really good.  I love the breakfast platters.  Their chocolate chip pancakes with the appropriate dusting of powderered sugar and chips on top make me go gooogooo gaaagghaa.  The prices are reasonable.  Service is awesome.  Stella would be proud of her kids who took it over after she passed.  The restaurant is on the corner and is simply so very bright with big huge windows.  No matter mood you are in, it will surely brighten after you come in and eat here.  My favorite part is talking to Gus, one of Stella's kids - who is by the way, no kid, but an experienced adult who knows what it takes to run a restaurant in the heart of Lake View.  I really enjoy going there every time

If I could have a job it would be just to eat at diners across the country and write about them on Yelp. Wouldn't that be like truly amazing? First, the place is super clean which is always a good thing, especially when it comes to diners which have a tendency to be less than beautiful inside. The staff was uber friendly. My friend who I was with new the owner/manager and she sat down with us at one point and chatted with us, constantly making sure things were good with our meal and believe me, they were. I love the art on the wall. They had cool handmade artwork with superheroes on them. That made me super happy (get it?) to see. For my meal I had their buffalo chicken salad which was huge. It was really spicy but definitely delicious. I couldn't finish it. Who can't finish a salad? I felt like less of a man that day. Either way, it was an amazing meal. I really liked it here. Great good. Great staff. Cool vibes. Fun neighborhood where it's located. Definitely a place I would recommend and a place I'd go back to the next time I'm in Chicago.
Food isn't anything special. Lots of regulars. People who work here are friendly and polite.

The people who work here are amazing...so welcoming, personable, helpful and great at their jobs. Food prices are fair, quality is outstanding and service is excellent. Large menu, plentiful seating and clean restroom. Ordered the turkey club and my partner had the turkey reuben. He had the mac and cheese as a side which was wonderful as were the sandwiches. He also had the cream chicken soup that was great. 1 coffee, 1 soda, 2 sandwiches and a bowl of soup and the bill was approx $31. Would return.

Stopped in the day after moving into the neighborhood. The diner is cute and I sat at the bar. I got breakfast- eggs, hash browns, bacon, and country gravy. Super yummy and affordable! I could tell this diner is well established in the neighborhood because everyone knew each other and I distinctly felt like an outsider. but other than that the service was quick, just not as personable. Something to be aware of if you're not from or new to the area
Packed on Sunday, so we sat at the bar. Great service and great tasting brunch.  The egg scramble had a lot of veggies and the hash browns were cooked with just enough crispness.

Went with a friend and we both had awful food. The burger was dry and looked like a rubber tire. The chicken fingers soggy and tasted old. To top it all off one us had to use the bathroom several times while shopping on Broadway because the food did not agree with the stomach. Will NEVER return and instead eat at the other diners in the area.
My go-to spot for an early-morning BYOB chicken noodle soup

Cozy little corner diner that offers all of the classic foods you crave when you're too far from mom's house! The staff gets an A+ in comparison to other restaurants and make you feel like family. My boyfriend and I have been here several times and have made a few favorites.. such as their crispy chicken salad, basically every wrap they offer, and their turkey is made fresh every day! Would recommend to anyone looking for a low-key delicious spot who may also be craving a milkshake! (My favorite is the dreamsicle!!)
Have been there countless times and have never had anything less than great! If possible, grab a booth near the front window cause people watching there is great!
Good food! Didn't have to wait on a Saturday! Big portions! Not exactly healthy but I guess who goes to a diner to be healthy.

Food was ok , prices economical . Vanilla shake was the best of all. Service at the counter - BAD . Demanded tip with a certain percentage higher than normal below which they wont accept. Not so welcoming attitude at the counter. Would never go back again.

I love Stella's! I am not a fan of the pomp and circumstance that surrounds "brunch" *shudders* and would prefer some good ol' diner breakfast any day. Don't get me wrong, I can certainly enjoy some crab benedict, but.. what's the point of a cool ambiance, and fancy plating, if your food.. is just made with no heart?  Anyway, Stella's has never disappointed me in this regard. The backdrop of a diner may not be instagram worthy (eyeroll), but I have never left feeling anything less than supremely satisfied. The servers are attentive, the food always comes out hot, and I haven't tried anything I haven't liked yet.

I really want to love this place but I can't say it's 5 stars. We had decent food and I really like the vibe of the place although the service was just alright. I asked for more coffee once and the lady took my cup without a word and never came back... Overall we liked it and will probably go again.

Decided to give Stella's Diner another shot with my love for Sunday Brunch. Beware, they are packed to the rim on Sunday. This is typical of a lot of restaurants in Chicago during brunch but having no designated waiting area sucks. Not only for the people waiting but for the people eating or staff trying to move around.  Service was where the three stars come in. Everyone forgets at least heck on your table to see if anything is missing. Drinks and parts of our food order made it at the tail end of our meal.  The food itself was okay. You get what you pay for here. Nothing to rave about but it doesn't taste like cardboard. The skillet is the way to go here. The waffle was good but my sausage links may have been old. All in all a decent meal for the price.
Love it. It's a diner with great food, great service, comfortable ambiance and an extensive menu. Breakfast bowls rock, as do the sandwiches. BYOB.

After walking out of a restaurant in Rogers Park hangry, ended up at Stella's. It was significantly busier than where we had just left and yet were seated after a mere five minute wait and had our food within twenty minutes of being seated.  Our waitress was as attentive as she could be given how busy she was and she still managed to catch a minor mistake before I had to say anything, given small OJ when a large was ordered.  The food was excellent. Ordered a gypsy skillet which has hash browns, diced ham, onions and mushrooms with my eggs over easy. Cooked to perfection and filling.  After paying and leaving I was stopped almost a block away by a busboy who found my wallet on the table and instead of putting it in lost and found chased me down Broadway. I mean, who does that! For that I would add a sixth star if I could.  Definitely have to go back and try something else and maybe a milkshake too.

Stella's embodies all things American diner. I've stopped in here for breakfast, lunch, dinner and just for a milkshake. The people are always incredibly friendly and welcome you in as if you're family- hard to beat that!  The food is just what you would hope for in classic diner style. I am a big fan of their grilled cheese and fries and have sampled a few other menu items. The garlic bread is actually surprisingly one of my favorite items here too - they make it a rather unique style and its delicious. The real win here is the milkshake. I've had a chocolate malt and vanilla shake (more than a few times) and they don't disappoint. Definitely recommend! The price is right, the service is amazing, and the food is just what you need.
Sooooo good!  Had the biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon. Biscuits were fluffy and gravy was super tasty!  Will definitely visit again!

This is a basic diner but the food is good.  We got seated right away during peak brunch time on a Sunday and the service was prompt and friendly.  We got the breakfast skillets, which we really good.   They were also very accommodating when I mentioned a food allergy.  This place is definitely worth trying.

Had a fantastic meal, was looking for a good classic patty melt and found a gem. Grilled to perfection and accompanied by fresh cut fries and killer coleslaw. The wait staff was fast and friendly and the owner was delightful. Will definitely be returning for and hope to save room for a milkshake!

Can't get enough of this place! Every time I go I try something new from their huge list of options and am never disappointed. Yes, their breakfast is something to write home about but their milkshakes are on a whole new level. Great staff makes the experience even better.
Super friendly staff and above average diner comfort food. Cute and clean inside too!

Are ya a new fan of Netflix's Stranger Things and wanna breathe somma dat Winona Ryder type 80's bliss? Stella's. This brightly-lit, local mural painted neighborhood diner has been uncranking the crank out of area locals for many moons. Can immediately tell if I like a diner by the first sip of their black coffee. Played hooky from the office one day and before snatching up a case or so of wine at nearby Binny's in Lakeview, decided to go live inside of one of the many wonderful early 80's style music videos while having a completely unhealthy but utterly delicious breakfast here. Mmm! Sometimes you just need to FEEL good and the small town friendliness heaped upon you by the staff should make you wanna call and thank your mama.

You totally get the family vibes from this restaurant from the second you walk in. The employees were super personable and this restaurant has a great menu! If you're looking for a solid brunch option in Lakeview, give Stella's a try. Definitely worth it.
Meh is exactly right. The food was only OK and the service wasn't very friendly. Not rude, just not friendly. Our breakfasts were OK but there were too many other places to go to return here.
Overpriced for the quality of the food and the menu is WAY too big. I do enjoy the decor though. This is a pretty middle of the road diner but you probably won't have a bad meal here.

Met at the door with a friendly greeting from the owner. Family owned and worked!!  We had turkey club & fries and the country fried steak dinner.  I had chilli with my dinner. EXCELLENT!  A mix of Midwest chilli and Tex/Mex. The mashed potatoes  are Real!   The turkey in the club sandwich was off the real turkey, delicious!  All the food was made in house!  No canned gravy here!! We wanted to try the desserts but we are way too full!!! We are definitely coming again!!!
I've been trying to move to Chicago for about a year.  This is the place that made me want to move to Chicago in the first place.
Great menu with a lot of options including breakfast served all day. Service is pretty good too. Milkshakes are delicious!

Good breakfast!  Pretty basic menu (unless you're going for a shake or malt) but it's well done. I didn't try the specials, but they sounded pretty good.  Place was hopping, as expected, but we were sat right away.  Close quarters for my liking, but it IS a corner diner.  The Hobo was well done. Seemed to be hand-grated hashbrowns. Always a winner in my book. Could've had a bit more flavor added through seasoning, but overall, it was very good. Especially loved the apple-chicken sausage.  My future sis-in-law had the country fried steak and gave each of us a taste of a biscuit that came on the side. I don't know what they do to those biscuits but damn! Delish.  My Guy's French toast looked yummy, and he really liked it.  Everything came out fast and hot! Waiters and bussers were all friendly and eager to help clear plates and refill drinks, etc.  Overall, a great spot to grab breakfast.

Hmm.. I have to say my peanut butter milkshake was incredible!! Yum. The blackened chicken quesadilla was just okay. I want to try something else next time. The staff wasn't memorable. For some reason I feel like the hostess and waitress hardly smiled.
Great local diner! I had one of their salads there and it was great! Prompt service but we were not rushed!
I walked in this place thinking it really seemed a cool spot to eat. The owner sit down with me and start talking about his redneckish mentality and him voting for trump. Another idiot in town

I feel like their food has gone down in quality since I started going here about a year ago. Skillets are pretty good still though!  Definitely reliable. Service is hit or miss -I've had the wrong plate delivered tome on multiple occasions, had waitresses/waiters take forever to take our order, have waited over 30 minutes to get our food from the kitchen.  It's the closest diner to home, but not my all-time favorite.

I went here the first day I moved to Chicago and ended up going 4 days in a row. They have THE BEST breakfast ever with great coffee to match! The atmosphere is cute and fun, and so is the staff! I want to take all my friends here and definitely will! Stella, you rule!!

I want to love this place and I hate to give a bad review. The customer service is excellent! They wait on you hand a foot and make you feel great dining here. I really appreciate that! The prices are great--you can get a pretty cheap meal. Unfortunately, the food just isn't good. I've eaten here on 2 occasions (once for dinner and once for breakfast) and I found the food to be tasteless and flavorless. Maybe I'll try apple pie and ice cream or a milkshake for next time.

I moved to the city less than a week ago, while out exploring the neighborhood I passed Stella's. I decided to give it a try. The service is fast and friendly, then food was good, and the prices were reasonable. I got a spinach,tomato and feta egg white omelette and hash browns. The man who works the pay counter is full of personality and makes each persons visit feel important. With all that said I will be returning to Stella's in the future.
I adore Stellas and everyone that works in the place.  The food is home-style cooking and makes us feel like we're home.
Friendly workers. The burger melted my tastebuds it was so good. Will come back after more Cub games!

I love going to Stella's it always reminds me of home. I'll usually go for dinner - their egg skillets are so bomb. I do a skillet and a milkshake haha. Owner really takes pride in his diner and is a really nice guy. His dad opened it decades ago

Great little diner with a big selection. I had their homemade tuna salad sandwich and it was very tasty-- not drowned in mayo like most diners! Same with their cole slaw, which was great. Prices were fair and the milkshake selection was mouthwatering! Very clean, with lots of interesting art on the walls. I was waiting here for my movers to show up to my new apartment for a few hours, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.
The food was extremely disappointing. Chicken soup wasn't hot. Meatloaf tasted like cafeteria food. Service was friendly.

Good diner for any meal.  This place is great for breakfast all day.  They have a huge menu but I always prefer the omelette here, (I prefer the bagel across the street for anything sandwich wise-) but you really can't go wrong!  All in all great go to for a bite or a meal!

This place is as good as it gets for the kind of place it is.  Casual easy food, friendly atmosphere, family owned.  I had a club sammich and my wife a salad, adjusted as only she can do.  Owners daughter waited on us.   It wasn't very busy on a Monday at 730p, so the owner Gus came over and sat with us.   Funny and friendly.    Very good cole slaw!  I am particular about slaw. We will be back.  Maybe tonight!

The waiter refused to check the ingredients of a meal I wanted to order. Every restaurant has a book or binder with the ingredients of everything they serve so they are able to check in the case of food allergies. The laziness of the server made me unable to order the meal I wanted. Bad service that leads to me not being able to eat at the restaurant is just bad business. I wont be returning.
Solid breakfast joint. Had one of their skillets, something to do with Texas. The chili had beans (not a Texas thing), but it tasted great. You should try this place.

Quick and friendly service. Great neighborhood atmosphere with a simple menu. It's everything you would want in a breakfast diner. Haven't tried the milkshakes, but will definitely be going back to get one!

Not much can be said about this diner. It was a typical diner with typical diner food. The service was great! I cannot tell you our waitresses name, but she was a wonderful and responsive person. She gave our six person group enough time to order, food was out promptly, and she made light conversation with us. She was a great waitress and the food was very good-huge portions! I'm tiny, but I like to eat so this was great for me. However, when we went to the counter to pay, the cashier asked us, whats your tip.. Which i thought was rude, I tip well, being in the service industry myself. He then said, how about tipping 20%? (Which I already did). I told him okay and tipped the "20%" he suggested. Did I calculate wrong? Nope! He made me tip more than 20% I was very disappointed with the treatment at the cash register. I respect waitresses being a waitress myself. Overall, food =good, service=good, payment process=embarrassing. Make your own decision, but I am not going back to be treated like that. P.s. I called to tell them about my feelings, and I was told that i was not tipping enough and they were looking out for their waitresses. I guess I only wish I had a manager that forced people to tip me more too.

Very disrespectful manager. This is how I feel and I know he won't care how I feel because he told me flat out he doesn't care how I feel. Embarrassed my friends and I about tips to a great waitress. She was wonderful. A tip is just that: a tip. It's an extra, and definitely unnecessary gesture. One tips when he or she feels his or her servers deserve it. Don't judge others for what they can or cannot afford. I've been in the service business. I know how it is. How about instead of judging your customers, treat your servers better. Pay them more. Give them a larger piece of the income.  I tried not to let the manager ruin the review, but honestly the food is not great. Its average, just slightly better than an IHOP, and left me hungry. The servers are sweet. But all managers are a reflection of the establishment and in this case Stella's fails to meet expectations.  Thank you for speaking to me on the phone. I believe we will have to agree to disagree. You shouldn't be treating your customers in this way. I understand you will continue to treat each customer the same way and that this in your mind is fair. I disagree. It isn't any of your business. I do not plan on returning. You've lost my patronage. Again, great waitress. This is by no means a reflection of you. Keep smiling!

The food is pretty good and I've never had a problem with the service. When I lived down the street I would often go here.  However, one evening (a while ago) as I was checking out, the owner Gus made several flirtatious comments towards me. Apparently being "funny" is his thing, so that is probably what he was going for...but it made me feel really uncomfortable.   Otherwise, this is a good neighborhood diner. The food is a lot better than Melrose down the street, and since The Edge closed, it is one of the few spots left in the area like this.

I walked into Stella's Dinner with a friend at 9:04pm. I've read reviews, heard great service and food...decided why not give it a try. Anywho, we walk up to the host and he instructs us to take a seat. We do just that. I look at the menu, and everything sounds delicious. Within a few minutes in ready to order. But everyone is standing around chatting, laughing, or walking back and forth. At 9:21 not one person had asked me if I wanted anything to drink or if was ready to order. I decided to leave, that's unacceptable. I won't be coming back to this place.

Great milkshake! Awful service. We went there because we were in the neighborhood and it seemed to be a nice play. But no it wasn't, servers are awful and rude. If you wanna have some good lunch/dinner there is plenty of places around where you can have a really nice meal

They could use some improve in their service! We were at the table for a long time without being notice for the waitress and the place wasn't busy at all, I'm when I tried to place the order with the guy that seated us, he was super rude!. When she finally went to the table and we told her that we will leave, she apologized with the other guy, not us!! Unbelievable!

Stella's. Gotta love it if you live in Lakeview east. It's the hangover cure I've used many times in the past, and will continue to use in the future. No frills, no nonsense classic brunch offerings. Everything is pretty good here - nothing too fancy or 5 star incredible, but it hits the spot when you're craving that classic brunch itch, much more so than anywhere around Lakeview east (I'm looking at you, Yolk and Orange). Hit it up sometime.

Me and Stella's? We're Donion Rings. This is thanks to my fiance and I being ignored for an hour within their dirty walls. At first I assumed they were short-staffed, though on a Friday evening it's unlikely, and as we continued to wait... we discovered the culprit was laziness. Upon arriving, a bus boy provided menus and water (then more water). We waited 10 minutes for a waitress to acknowledge our presence (after stacking the menus on a ledge and looking around for service). We ordered fries, onion rings, and a brownie sundae. We then waited a half hour for their arrival. The food was flavorless, though that is beside the point. In preparation for our sundae, over the next 30 minutes- we stacked our plates, used the restroom, looked around bewildered, received multiple water refills from the busboy, and began boiling with frustration. I grabbed my purse and walked over to the front desk to wait for the manager, who had been manning it most of the night. The waitress suddenly noticed me! I explained how long we'd been waiting and she called for her manager. He then lazily strolled over, gave me my check and asked if I wanted to add tip. Never was there an explanation or apology for the lack of service.

Best milkshake/malt EVER! Had a gypsy skillet w/a side of sausage gravy & biscuit for lunch. FANTASTICO! Crispy hash browns & eggs cooked to perfection!  Wish I lived nearby. Place is spic n span & waem, wonderful service!

Love this place. Staff is very nice. Owners are always present. Been here for a million years. Breakfast - I love the breakfast quesadilla. Little pricy since there is no meat but it is very good. Dinner - open face turkey sandwich!!!!!!!!!!  I get this every time. Scarf it down. It is basically the sandwich your mom made you the day after Thanksgiving.  Great turkey, gravy, potatoes, bread and cranberries. It's a sloppy mess of goodness. Enjoy.

It was frigid on Saturday morning and this place was busy. There's really no waiting area in the front so there were groups of people waiting for tables kinda on top of one another. They won't seat you until your entire party is there (on the weekends only) so that was a bummer. There is also only 1 men's and 1 women's restroom stall in the back. For a place that large, it would be nice to have more so the wait isn't so long. Once we did get seated, thankfully it was towards the back half of the diner so we weren't surrounded by the other waiting patrons, our server (didn't catch his name) was very upbeat. The menu has a good number of options and breakfast specials so there's something for everyone. My eggs were scrambled a little harder than I would have liked (I asked for soft) so with the cheese on top it looked rather dry. I added hot sauce and such so it was fine. My meal came with pico, hash browns and warm tortillas on the side. Overall, I was satisfied but not overly hyped. The price was right though and I think it might be BYOB.

In short; 4/5 stars for very good service, nice atmosphere, and good food. Misses a star because my soup was a bit iffy and a little on the expensive side. I would definitely recommend this place to others.  Stopped at this place with my girlfriend on our way home. It was about a 10 minute walk from the nearest brown/red line stop in a nice neighborhood with a 63 bus stop right across the street.  The Building is nice with a lot of self done art on the walls that looks nice. The service was great; everyone was really nice and I could hear the employees refer to some of the regulars by name. We got seated after about 5 minutes of waiting which is nice because we went ona busy sunday morning (also was valentine's day.) We got our food incredibly quick, we ordered, I went to the bathroom, and by the time I came back, they brought our food out, granted we didn't order anything overly complicated, but still impressive timing.  I ordered the "Hungry Person Breakfast" which is 3 eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, and hashbrowns all for $10. Also got a French onion soup which was slightly disappointing. I LOVE French onion soup and get it everywhere it is available, and this one the bread was a little rough and the cup was nearly half full with onions. But all in all the food was good.

Best burger in Lakeview! It was so delicious!!!!!! Perfect place for my last meal living in Chicago. The waiter and host were super friendly and made our experience that much better. I went with three other people and we all got different things and we all left satisfied! I got the avocado burger, my mom got the bbq burger, my dad got a salad, and my friend got the meat loaf. We were so full by the end of the meal that we didn't even have room for one of their tasty looking milkshakes!

Dear Lord this place is awesome!   Classic diner with better than classic diner fare!   I love their salads, so fresh!  Craving carbs?  You must, yes must get their version of garlic bread (do not, trust me...do not order this on a first date), their mac and cheese and meat loaf plate.  All are truly fantastic. Great wait staff, clean décor with some whimsical touches.  Good, hot coffee.  Yep, a classic diner in every sense.  Great wait staff too and the owner is a great guy. Go here when you are hungry, go here when you are hungover, go here when you want a fresh and beautifully presented salad, go here when you want a hot bowl of soup on a cold winter day.  Just go here, you will not be disappointed!

I've been to Stella's a solid 15 times. It's okay if you're looking for a cheap fast breakfast but the quality just seems sub par considering the neighboring options. They have "NO SUBSTITUTIONS" written clearly on the menu- always a nice way to let you know they're not too accommodating so just pick something and run with it. What puzzles me is the dichotomy between the wait staff and the host staff. The wait staff are professional and friendly while the host staff, particularly the woman on the weekend mornings, leave much to be desired in the customer service department. Please note I have really only had breakfast and lunch (maybe 1-2x) so I can't speak for their milkshakes, one thing they are supposed to be known for.  If you're in the neighborhood it's worth a try if you're little pressed for time, if not try Wilde down the street.

I love this place. Easily my favorite brunch spot in Lakeview/Lincoln Park. Here are all the reasons I love it: - Never waited for more than 15 minutes, even for a group of 8 on a Sunday morning - The coffee gives me life - The food is just plain and simple good. My boyfriend and I have had the Strawberry Pancakes, Bacon Jack Chicken Sandwich, Chicken Parm Sandwich, and Ham Skillet and have loved them ALL Great service, great vibes, great food.

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and felt welcomed here. The place for some reason reminds me of the diner the folks on Seinfeld always ate at. Service and food are both very good. This is indeed my go to breakfast spot!
Really like this place. I would recommend giving it a try. But what big don't like is yelp making me write more in this review just to post it! Yelp is getting one star here...

I went to Stella's with a group of friends for a casual dinner on a Saturday night and was blown away by the amazing service and great, classic diner food.  We called ahead for our group of seven, and they were able to easily accommodate our size. We were greeted and seated immediately once we arrived. Waters were quick to the table, and our server, Laura, started us off with a recommendation for the garlic bread. I'm so glad that we followed her suggestion - the bread was delicious and one order was more than enough for the table. I don't think I'll ever go back to Stella's without ordering the garlic bread to start!  Laura was also happy to give recommendations for our meals and answer any questions we had on the menu. I ordered the turkey pesto sandwich with Cajun fries. Others at my table ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich, rueben sandwich, and the chicken tender basket. All were more than happy with their choices. My turkey sandwich was huge - enough to bring half home. The fries were just the right amount of crispy and the Cajun seasoning was very good. The meal also came with a small side of creamy cole slaw which was delicious. Since Stella's is BYOB, we brought a few bottles of wine to enjoy with our meal as well.  What made Stella's stand out to me was the service demonstrated by the staff and owners of the restaurant. Gus chatted with us throughout the meal, providing laughs and stories to accompany our food. Laura was attentive but not overbearing, and both she and Gus seemed to genuinely care about our dining experience. All of the staff seemed to be in a great mood, and enjoyed interacting with the patrons. At the end of our meal, Laura brought over small scoops of complimentary ice cream and was easily able to split our bill seven ways.  Our whole group left Stella's happy and satisfied. There is no doubt that we will be back to enjoy the food and atmosphere again soon.

We came to Stella's for a nice weekend lunch.  Of course, we got breakfast, which wonderfully served at all times.  We were seated right away.  The place was clean and neat and smelled awesome. I ordered the skillet special, which had chorizo in it.  I love chorizo.  Like really love it.  And the skillet was loaded with it, so I was a happy guy.  Everything tasted great, from the coffee on to the hash browns (extra crispy) to the side pancakes.  Food was fast and hot and yummy.  No complaints there.  No, not the best I have ever eaten, but the menu was nicely complete, with some cool takes on old favorites that I can't wait to try. The real stars here are the staff, however.  The server was funny and friendly and really awesome.  But the buss boys who came by and refilled water and coffee were the best.  They didn't hang around us, but the instant we needed something, even if we didn't realize it, they were there to take care of us.  Seriously, nice job guys. I can't wait to go back!

My good friend and I were here on New Year's Day and we had different experiences. We both found the atmosphere and the staff to be very lovely. We had differing food experiences, though. She got the chicken tenders and French fries, and thought her chicken was a tad undercooked. She left unimpressed.  I, on the other hand, (following my waitress' recommendation) got the chicken Parmesan spaghetti with the French onion soup and mine was DELICIOUS! The soup had plenty of perfectly-broiled Gruyere cheese on top- so good. Then my food came out- the spaghetti was perfectly cooked and the chicken was deliciously seasoned and prepared. I devoured my food and left a happy camper.  The enjoyment of this diner seems contingent on the food you order. I suggest asking your server for food recommendations! No matter what you order at Stella's, you'll find a colorful atmosphere populated with friendly faces. Whenever I'm on Broadway, Stella's is always a great choice to grab a quick, sit-down bite to eat.

If you prefer your diner's to have a Cheers sort of feel then Stella's is for you. It's a laid-back joint where everyone knows each other's name. Since I work across the street from them, I frequent the diner often and I know most of the staff's names and even some of the regular's names. Roe/Row, Gayle, and Maria are the greatest!  The food is pretty straight forward which is how I prefer my breakfast. Nothing too fancy but flavorful. It comes out quickly and the wait staff stop by often to check up on you. This is definitely my go-to for breakfast/brunch!

I have a fondness for institutions...places that manage to weather the decades by sticking to a tried and true formula always gives me a warm fuzzy feeling. Stella's is such a place. It puts me in mind a bit of Lou Mitchells...a neighborhood diner that has been there for a very long time and will likely continue to do so for the foreseeable future. I came here with my wife and infant son in the morning on New Years Eve 2015. We took some time to look at the menu...the manager (who i think is the grandson of the founder) noticed that we were weighing options and offered to give us advice on other neighborhood options if this was not what we were looking for. We decided that this looked good and went with it. We ordered skillets, one veggie and one with avocado.  Both were filling and satisfying and reasonably priced. Our waitress was attentive and super sweet. Best of all it was clear that his was a neighborhood joint...the staff seemed to know most if not all of the blue collar the guys who were stopping in for their morning meal. Even though this was our first (and quite possibly last) visit we felt just as welcome. Overall a great place for good, satisfying traditional American breakfast food.
Highly recommend! Great place for a hungover brunch. Try the eggs benedict, its one of the best I've ever had. Very down to earth and low key spot.

What a gem. The food is terrific and the service is 5 stars plus.  We have ordered delivery multiple times. When an issue arose last night with our delivery, Gus, the owner, took the time to call, explain the situation, apologize for the issue, assure us that our order was being redone given the delay, and let us know he made special arrangements to get us our order quickly. The food arrived not long thereafter and it was perfect. And, Gus included a handwritten note that was very funny.  We have favorite diners in other cities and Stella is the best we have found in Chicago. Try it. You will not be disappointed. (And thank you Gus.)

Poor service, try the place across the street.  Expensive for what it is. A diner. It's all about service. Nothing worse than getting forgotten by the front desk and your waitress. Very laid back attitude here.

We had Stella's delivered by Grub Hub. It was delicious. Me and my daughter had Italian dishes which were great. I also had chicken noodle soup which was delicious. I highly recommend Stella's for their food. I don't know about the restaurant itself since we didn't actually go.
Very kind staff. A very home setting type of place. Very good food and knowledgeable staff. This is one of the gems of Lakeview and someplace I will definitely be going back to.

I feel so at home when I'm here. Great food and great staff especially Sam!  She was a great waitress and extremely attentive!  The other diners in this area can't run touch the food quality, atmosphere and service at Stella's!
The atmosphere of this place is worth 5 stars. Food is decent, though not of exceptional quality. French onion soup was actually the best thing I ordered- everything else slightly lacked flavor.

Stella's diner was so fun! I went here at around 11:30 on Sunday morning with my boyfriend's parents. There were 5 of us and only a 10 minute wait. We all ordered some variation of a skillet. Most of us ordered the vegetarian skillet (including me), then someone ordered the Mexican Jolt and my boyfriend ordered the West Coaster (plus pico). The skillets are HUGE. I could not even finish half of mine, it was delicious and I loved all the vegetables. Apparently the Mexican Jolt was also good, with just the right amount of heat. However, I really want to highlight my boyfriend's order which I will definitely be ordering upon my return. It was by far the best dish at the table. Including the pico was definitely the right choice and I think next time if we put some chopped bacon in there, it will be like the inside of a breakfast burrito! I am really excited to go back to Stella's again and have the West Coaster all to myself!

Noticed during lunch most of the customers are regular that the 3rd generation owner knows most of their names! Very home my, friendly atmosphere the moment you stepped in. Great service! I had burger which came with very generous portion of sautéed onion and mushroom on soft bun. Wish we have more options for the bun! Definitely worth coming back!

So happy to have this diner down the street.  Right at Barry & Broadway, Stella's is a classic neighborhood diner. Family run, the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I like when I go to a place, and they remember me. Sometimes I just grab a quick coffee & bagel, or eat in for breakfast. I love sitting at the service bar, when I'm there myself. Service is quick and no attitudes ever. Classic diner food and shakes make for a delicious meal out. YUM

Stella's is my boyfriend  and I's go to spot for breakfast or bruch. They have a mom n' pop feel and they are always packed. They just recently updated thier place which looks even better. Their food is also amazing and affordable. My boyfriend always order the hungry person ( 2 eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, and hashbrowns with toast). I usually change my order from thier french toast or waffles. There are times their pancakes are phenomenal and times when it is dry.  But everything else in thier menu is pretty basic and have a home-cooked meal feeling. We've also tried their dinner menu and they have a very big serving, which I know most people would love.  The best thing about this place is the people, there are customers that have been regular for many many years and the workers are so nice and funny, even if they are sooo crazy busy.  This a place you always go back to and build memories at.

I've lived in the neighborhood for nearly 10 years now and Stella's has been my go-to spot for the entire time for brunch (served all-day Saturdays and Sundays). First, the food is great quality yet there's nothing fancy or trendy about it. In turn, the prices are on-point- $8-10 for a skillet depending on your ingredients. The menu has something for everyone, service is fast, and my coffee cup is frequently topped off. Even if there's a line for a table, turnover is fast so you won't wait long. This doesn't mean you're rushed through your meal either; they just happen to be quick at taking your order and making your food.  I've also noticed that the same servers continue to work there for years and years- I can only assume it's a well-run business if people stick around so long, right? That gives me extra incentive to frequent this place. Other added bonuses- there are all ages at this place and it's lively without being overtly noisy. I'm happy here, and my parents are happy here (which is important, right). People have suggested other diners to me and they just never measure up to Stella's.
Good breakfast, but kitchen has been very slow the last two times I've been there. (arrives ~20 min after ordering)

Great breakfast food, meat is sometimes questionable. Owner tries to make you feel at home but he doesn't care when it comes to accommodating guests at late hours. Says they close at 10 but start kicking people out at 930.

Stella's has always been one of my favorite spots in Lakeview, if not all of Chicago. I left the city for about 2 years, and after arriving back, hitting up Stella's was at the top of my to-do list. I ordered the Veggie breakfast skillet, and I'm SO GLAD I DID! Previously, I'd only ever tried the Hobo skillet, which is basically the same thing sans veggies. But the veggies were the best part! Cooked to perfection, and very flavorful; not too crispy, not too mushy.  In true breakfast-for-dinner fashion, I also ordered a Salted Caramel Pretzel Shake for dessert. Delicious! The chunks of pretzel made it almost taste like a malted shake, and who doesn't love salted caramel?! The service was great as always, and the prices can't be beat! Can't wait for my next trip back to Stella's.

I won't even try their food due to horrible service. I went in with a service dog to get a shake to go after I had just had jaw surgery.  I was treated like dirt and asked to stand in the corner by the bar, only the. To be yelled at by someone who claimed to be the manager. You see they apparently have never herd of the disability act and will not serve anyone with a service animal. The manager said I was lying about my dog being a service animal - my dog had on its vest and I had her paperwork in email form which they would not even look at and then asked me to leave. I was embarrassed and sick . The worst part is when I posted this to the public I found out I was not the only victim.

Ate here 3 days in a row during our visit. Once at lunch and 2 mornings at breakfast. Food was outstanding and the staff was very friendly. Last day there, I had the country fried steak and eggs.....WOW was it good. You gotta try it!

My dad recently wanted to show me one of his favorite spots and I couldn't believe I'd never been here before! I was immediately won over by the atmosphere. This place is the pinnacle of "cute diner". I ordered the Country Style Eggs Benedict, two of my favorite dishes combined (eggs benedict and biscuits and gravy). When I asked for no ham, our waiter practically INSISTED I replace it with something else (I settled for bacon) so while most places don't like swap-outs, this place is apparently more than ok with it. Oh, and I always ask for my hash browns "extra well done", which I call a gamble. It usually falls on deaf ears, but not here! I actually got crispy hash browns!  Food came out fast and hot, service was attentive. Everything tasted great. Joyous breakfast for dinner. I'll definitely be back.

Stella's is the best! The breakfast is always amazing (biscuits and gravy, ftw!). They have all the "diner" favorites (burgers, pasta, sandwiches), but definitely kick it up a notch. I recently tried the catfish my bf ordered and it was breaded and seasoned to perfection.  One of my favorite meals there is probably the cabbage soup and the spinach pinwheels. An odd combo, sure, but so tasty and satisfying.  On one of the most recent trips, we took the suggestion of a fellow diner who told us to order the chocolate pudding. Stella's has a lot of desserts to choose from, like the multiple shakes and sundaes, but I had no idea about pudding. We ordered it and it definitely lived up to the hype.  The owner and all the staff are always so friendly and welcoming, too. You'll find yourself wanting to come back, for sure!

I love Stella's!  The food is great (my go-to is the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich with a side of ranch) and the atmosphere is fun.  Great art on the walls, colorful and laid back!  Gus has the ability to tell you to go to hell so you look forward to the trip! Great place to take your out of town friends for a bite,and the desserts are amazeballs.  Yes, I'm a grown-ass man and I just used the word amazeballs. That's how much I like Stella's!

You know that emoji that is just a straight line mouth? That's my face when thinking about this place, the definition of average. Average food. Average service. Average prices. Average location. It's hard for me to get excited about it but also hard to bash it too much. I do appreciate how they continually keep them water filled, but can't stand how I have to wait in a never ending line literally out the door.  To their credit however, they do make a pretty solid omelette and they have some combinations you don't often see, like broccoli and munster cheese. Can't say I would have thought of that combo on my own and now I love it, so go stellas! I've also had the pancakes and bacon and scrambled eggs. Nothing terrible, but nothing amazing either.  I wouldn't be too mad to go back, but if I'm going to spend my hard earned money, I want a place that wows me.

I've eaten in and gotten delivery from Stella's Diner numerous times and I honestly don't know why I keep ordering from here. I think it must have something to do with the $1 delivery charge on grub hub. Honestly, their food is terrible and I have tried so many things on their menu (club sandwich, grilled cheese, chicken soup, salads, etc). Everything is "meh" at best. Most recently I ordered a grilled cheese with a side of mac and cheese. The grilled cheese barely had any cheese on it, and was mostly bread and tomatoes. And the mac and cheese had a very odd seasoning on it. It didn't taste anything like traditional mac and cheese! Boo Stella's. You guys could  be so much better. .

Friendly neighborhood atmosphere, enough menu choices to please the entire family - from "comfort foods" to breakfast all-day, great burgers and YUMMY milkshakes - Stella's is a great restaurant with plentiful portions and affordable too!

Stella's is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to eat. I've always been pro any place that has all day cheap breakfast. I've visited Stella's on different occasions, ranging from dates to solo, and they never fail to leave me smiling when I leave.  Pros:  - Large amounts of food for reasonable prices - the food isn't that memorable though - No matter how busy they seem the wait time to sit down is always very quick - This is a great place to go if you and your friends can't decide where to eat - The artwork in the restaurant is pretty cool and you will definitely be tempted to snap a photo or two - The owner is extremely nice and had us laughing while we waited to pay our bill Cons:  - There has always been a pretty long line to pay your check - The server are always hit or miss the few times I've gone

We were able to sit outside which was nice. The food was okay--pancakes a little dense. Eggs nice and fluffy.  Service was okay.  When we went to pay they asked my husband if he wanted to leave the change which would have meant $14 tip on a $26 meal.  We don't live very close to here and happened to be driving by so won't return.

Such a nice time here. Gus is a blast and made us feel right at home. Good diner fare with a Greek twist - had the Mediterranean chicken entree with feta which was great and the eggs and hash which was great too.
The one star is based on service alone.  The server we had was rude and I observed him make a pass at another guys lady companion.   Not cool

Every time that my husband and I have gone to Stella's with our two small children the staff has been so accommodating. From the minute we walk in the door everyone is so welcoming. One wait staff even drew a picture for my daughter to color! The food is always tasty. Thank you Stella's for making our family feel welcome! So happy to have you in the neighborhood.
An OKAY experience. The wait was long and the bacon cheeseburger was okay, but still an good experience. The owner is the sarcastic/funny type so that made it interesting.
Owners make an effort to learn the locals and treat everyone great. The food is amazing and service is always good. Definitely a great diner to check out for breakfast or dinner!

What to do when the people you're with can't decide what to eat? Find a diner, of course!!  After checking some Yelp reviews, we happened upon Stella's Diner.   We made our way over to Stella's and were cheerfully greeted upon entering and seated right away. Waters all around quickly parched our thirst. A very cheerful waitress soon stopped by to take our drink order and leave us with menu's.  My brother and I chose the 1/2 lb  bacon cheeseburgers with fresh cut fries and coleslaw. My daughter chose the hot turkey dinner, while my wife chose the corned beef on rye. The food arrived in practically no time and we dug in.  The coleslaw was great; creamy yet with a hint of vinegar. The burgers had a great charbroil flavor and the fries were just right.  The corned beef (on marbled rye) was moist and tender and almost no fat, and full of flavor. The turkey dinner had stuffing and potatoes and cranberry dressing and looked great.  The server was cute and funny and paid us plenty of attention without hovering too much. I cannot think of anything negative to say about Stella's. We will be back.  A very solid four stars.

Your standard diner. I went here for brunch and it was decent and what I expected. It's really hard to mess breakfast up.  I had a country fried steak with hash browns. Not bad at all, but things usually taste 5x better than reality when I am hungry and it didn't make me think I want to have it again. I have yet to try the dinner menu, but I imagine it would be alright.

I'm usually not an eggs-and-bacon kind of guy for breakfast (I usually prefer rice and soy sauce), but after seeing the reviews for this place, I thought "Why not? Why not eat some eggs and bacon, and then do whatever it is that white people do after eating breakfast?" (I still wonder).  So I visited this place with a few friends after a night of bad decisions, and here are my impressions: Pros: +Hand-grated parmesan cheese.  Enough said. +Very colorful decor inside. +Outdoor seating. +Very good food.  It's your typical breakfast fare, but pretty good by those standards. +Good portion size.  Not a heap of food placed on your face, but just enough to fill you up.  This is good, since it allows for more time and quality spent on a dish of the same price. +Friendly staff. Cons: -Don't know.  Didn't see anything wrong. It gets very busy here, so come early.
Sitting here drinking a strawberry shake and wondering, does it get much better than this? An excellent finish to my delicious BLT. Come here if you want a good meal provided by good people!

I'm coming here to say thank you for the throw back Stellas, their chicken noodle soup is my favorite. It reminds me of my grandpas, I was elated to notice the difference, they throws a little red bell pepper in just like my grandpa did and it reminds me of the exact same flavor he used to create! Their blackened chicken salad is one of my favorites as well. Love this place considering it's about 30 yards from where I live on Barry. Not to mention if you've had a fun Friday/Saturday night, the following morning if you order from them they make quick to get your breakfast/lunch order out fast, 15 minutes tops. The staff is wonderful, on a side note; I was walking past the place to go to my car and I saw a waitress come to inform a few out of towners that the parking on the end of Barry Ave was free after 6 at the green meters. Quality food, quality people, the places hits the spot. 10 stars.

You like a dinner?  You'll like Sella's. Hashbrowns and eggs showed up quickly and just the way I liked them. Wait staff was a little preoccupied with personal gossip even when they were at my table, but they were polite and kept my glass filled. Not as warm as a mom and pop dinner, but really good. I would recommend.
Good diner food, but perfect case for why you don't mix family and business.  Poor service and ever worse cashiers. Too many options in this area these days to tolerate rudeness and snark.

I have known the owner of this restaurant for a long long time n always very kind n generous to a customers & I give this restaurant a great effort of how they treated us all w a great customer service manners n a great food w friendly crews......will definitely come back to eat.....thank you for having me as a customer.  n ofcourse #1 breakfast diner restaurant ever in Lakeview.

I have been going to Stela's for 15 yrs so I know a few things about this place. If you want the best breakfasts, lunches, or dinners in the area,or the entire northside, then THIS is the place to go hands down.  Maria (Tula) Gus, and Jimmy and all who work there "ARE FAMILY"!! Its always packed on Sat. and Sunday mornings  but only cause the food is great.  The atmosphere is welcoming to everyone that shows up, the wait-staff is just sweet-hearts, with warm smiles, and will ALWAYS go beyond what's just expected, to make sure you have everything you need, always! I personally love their biscuits and gravy, OMG.... better than anything in the area. But as I said, everything is good there, so RUN don't walk, take a taxi, whatever it takes to get there, BUT GET THERE!

I LOVE Stella's Diner! I consider myself to be somewhat of a Diner specialist, and this place hits all the marks. 1. Has very friendly and attentive service. In a city where hospitality in restaurants seems to be dwindling, I know that when I go to Stella's they'll treat me right! 2. Has great food. My favorite thing to get is one of their weekend specials - the breakfast quesadilla. So good! Actually, all of their quesadilla options are delicious and filling. 3. Great sized portions for a great price. 4. Good coffee. 5. Clean Bathrooms. I know that's a weird thing to judge a diner on, but it's part of my check list. So many diners have scary bathrooms. Stella's does not. 6. Malts, shakes, and DIVA CAKE! I highly recommend it to anyone that wants that Midwest diner experience. Check it out!

Great food and great service. Gus was sitting behind us and immediately started giving us a hard time so we felt right at home. We also took his suggestions and loved our meals. Virginia loves ya, Gus!

Guss is an old fat man prick that hit on my gf while we were having lunch. He's the owner supposedly and doesn't have respect for has customers and their girl friends.  There's nothing worse than a pervert, but an old man is even worse trying to get her information.  He has no respect. Be careful when you bring your gf here.  Major creeper alert and the food sucks and is over priced. McDonalds offers a better deal. Isn't he married with kids? I bet he is wishing now that he thought with the bigger head and asking how much was worth it.  You tried to have sex with my gf. Now I will give it to you in the hole without the lube in this review.

My wife and I have been going here since we moved nearby in December and have yet to have a bad meal. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner has all been good. Very busy, but it makes sense. If you want some classic American diner food, I highly recommend Stella's.
Best diner ever. Service is the best ever. Waiters and waitresses are on top of everything and the food is great. Will definitely be back

Best diner ever!  In NYC, that diners are "eh" and you know you should stick to breakfast items or burgers.  But this place had some interesting items.  I had the Mexican Hobo which was a potato hash dish with eggs.  It was very filling and quite cheap.  I paid $15 bucks with orange juice and all.   The service was on point with this cute old waiter with a bit of spunk.  So glad I tried this place.  Next time, I'll have to try the eggs benedict on biscuits and gravy.
Perfect diner right down the street.  I come every saturday morning and always get the best service.

I've eaten here twice in the last week and it was good both times. My complaint is that 75 cents for sriracha is absurd. Why must I smuggle my own hot sauce in for brunch because the hot sauce you include is subpar? This isn't 2005 - offer sriracha as a regular option. Overcharging your customers for a sauce that everyone else readily has on hand is a cheap move.

I was in there for lunch today and from start to finish every was excellent. It is a fun, casual diner when a cool retro vibe. The food was yummy ( you must try the mozzarella appetizer) and the owners are cool people you can't help but fall in love with. Great for all ages and events. A+++
Good old fashioned diner with good diner fair. Excellent customer service. This has become a once a week lunch time favorite.
We miss it here so much!!!! So good to see you Gus.  We love to come here and we will be back this summer.

I just moved to the neighborhood i few weeks ago and finally stopped in today for a late lunch with my gf and her friend. Gus greeted us at the door and even thumb wrestled my friend  it was awesome!  The food was very excellent. I had a burger which is handmade and actually cooked how i ordered it!  Then the super awesome server and i discussed milkshakes and i went with half oreo half peanut butter. it was unreal.  The best part was Gus coming over and talking to us about the neighborhood since we are new to this part of town.   What a great experience with great food!!

Stellas is awesome!  We just went there for the first time and I was impressed!  The owner was super friendly and helpful, he definitely cares about his customers.  The food was delicious- and there were a lot of options (I have some food allergies and there were still good options for me).  Great service, chill atmosphere.  Definitely would go back.

We've been here a couple of times and I've always enjoyed it. Today we came and got a milkshake and I decided it's time I wrote a review for them. That milkshake was soooo good. And the service was exceptional. We were sat immediately, and the staff were attentive, engaged, and friendly. The lady working behind the bar / counter was so pleasant. Thanks for a great snack! I'll be back!

I just want to begin by saying that this place has hands down the best customer service that I have ever experienced in my life. The owner Gus is one of the kindest and most thoughtful people I have ever met and the food is great.   I ordered some food from them via Grubhub and the order was missing fries.  I also accidentally ordered the side mac and cheese thinking it was the meal.  I told the driver upon arrival that I though the order was wrong.  I didn't complain, but the driver mentioned something to Gus.  Ten minuets later I get a call from the owner, apologizing for the mishap and insisting to bring me over a corrected order.  He listened to me and let me tell him what had happened, which in and of itself is a miracle. Most place just cut you off and say sorry nothing we can do for you.  I told him that wasn't necessary but he did it anyways and even tiped his own driver.   I have to say that in a time when no one values their customers, I completely understand why they have been around for so long.  He went out of his way to please one customer and I'm sure he does the same for others.  I love this place and I sincerely hope that all of you support local business that have the same type of integrity and pride about their product as Stella's does.  5 MILLION STARS in my book.  I'll be coming back for years to come.  Thank you Gus for making me feel like a special customer. I am truly impress by your care for the customer and your kindness. Your what Chicago restaurants should be.  Take notes people, treating others with respect is what gets you loyal customers!!!

Stella's is super laid back and even when it's busy it doesn't feel loud or overcrowded. Quick and kind service, inexpensive, and the breakfast is good for the price. It's the kind of place I love to go and chill on a Sunday, and there is rarely if ever a wait to get seated. My only complaint is they charge you $2.25 for every single tea bag. Come on guys...

Came here because of the high rating on yelp. Overrated. First the hostess gets my name wrong. That's not really that big a deal, but please don't call me Hilary and act like I'm the rude one when I tell you my actual name. Our waitress was also rude and unfriendly. She was rushing us to order just a couple of minutes after being seated. Then someone a few seats over fainted. Not one minute after that our waitress was asking us if we'd decided on our orders. We had not because we were distracted by the person that collapsed just a minute ago. After we ordered and received our food, the order was wrong. We let it slide because we didn't feel like extending this experience. Oh, and when my girlfriend went to the restroom another waitress tried to move by her and said "behind you!". I guess it's easier than saying excuse me. Goodbye forever.
A great place for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Everyone is so friendly and the prices are reasonable. One of the favs in the neighborhood.

Decent greasy spoon type diner. Very fast service. Gets busy on weekends and on beautiful summer days. They have outdoor seating. Breakfast eggs are usually undercooked because they are so quickly pumping things out of the kitchen, so I order things to be overcooked a little, then they come out better.

Gotta make it rain up in this b****!!!!!! And that's exactly what happened. Not even kidding you. I came by here with a friend and was starving like I hadn't eaten in days. I ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich and my friend (she likes to be mentioned on yelp, her name is Christina) ordered chocolate chip pancakes. Oh yes. Buffalo chicken sandwich was deliciousssss and the cajun fries were awesome too. Chocolate chip pancakes were good and had a shit ton of whipped cream on there, which is never a bad thing.  The dessert though. The brownie with extra fudge and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Your mouth will have an orgasm. Mine did. It was heavenly.  *drools* The customer service! Yeeeaahhhhhhhh those people are crazy and in the best way possible. The manager of the restaurant took our tip that we left for our amazing server and made it rain on her. You heard me.  Well you actually didn't hear me, you're reading this, but yeah. He made it rain. Those are my type of people. Go here and they'll be yours too.  Bring them dolla dolla bills yo.
